body.p:
Stanford Feb 12th 1865
His Exelency
Thos E Bramlete Gov Ky
Dear Sir

Our part of the state is verry much infested with guerrillas who are murdering our citizens stealing our horses and devastating our country generally and we stand in great need of help. If it is possible for you to send us a company of cavalry to be stationed for a short time at Hustonville it will be the means of saving the town and surrounding county, our need is pressing and our wants are urgent.

The facts in the case are about these three ^two^ weeks ago a band of cut throats came to Hustonville killed Leut Connigham and Stole several horses made there way to Danville committed sundry depredations then and moved off into the vicinity of Harrodsburgh when Capt Bridgewater came up with them and punished them severly a few days since they returned to the Roling Fork in the nighborhood of Maj George murdered Mr Pruett of Casey County when Capt Bridgewater again assembled his men surprised them at night killed four of their member and dispersed the balance from the prisoners take from their band we learn that it is the determination of there leader to burn the town of Hustonville we do not know when to look for them but we feel assured that they will return and reek there vengance on the defensless
town and its inhabitants now we do pray you to send us some help, if you have not got it at your command perhaps a suggestion from you to the Genl Commanding would have the effect to get us some help from the Federal forces in Ky if the storm can be stayed for a short time our own men will volunteer and defend themselves and there houses as soon as they can be armed and equiped by the state our men are anxious to go into the state service and will immediately commence enroling themselves for that purpose all they is protection untill they can be organized and equiped Capt Bridgewater and his men have done all that could be done with the limited force under his command if he had more guns and ammunition he could man them in sufficient force to rid this part of the state of all such maurading and murdering theives hoping that you will give this a ^favorable^ consideration we are

Sir your obedient friends
George Drye of Casey Co
J S Robertson of Lincoln Co
B.. F.. Brown Hustonville
A. A. Campbell. Do
A Hicks. Do

Stanford Ky
Feby, 12" 1865
Robertson J. S. And others
To the Gov.
Asks that a Co. of Cavy. be stationed at Hustonville --
L B No 10-1865 P. 160
Recd A. G. O. Ky 16 Feby 1865

To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlete
Frankfort
Ky
There are clevermen but ought to know we have no cavalry to send.
